wordPressPost.title: Don’t Buy Another Probiotics Supplement Before Reading This
wordPressPost.content:
Probiotics are edible products that contain the beneficial bacteria that inhabit the digestive system. In the digestive tract, the bacteria aid in completing the digestive process. They also aid in the production of vitamins.

Types of probiotics

There are many types of bacteria also called probiotics but most of them come in two main groups: Lactobacillus and Bifidobacterium. Lactobacillus is the most common, and you can get it bu consuming yogurt and other fermented products. Bifidobacterium is less popular and often present in dairy products.

Benefits of probiotics

Probiotics have many benefits in the body. Some of these benefits include:

  • Treatment of digestive problems:

Diarrhea is the most common digestive problem. Several reports show that probiotics come in handy in the prevention and treatment of infectious, travelers and antibiotic diarrhea.

The reports also show that certain species of Lactobacillus are highly effective in the treatment of infectious diarrhea in children. The bacteria work by keeping the digestive system in balance thus it functions optimally. Due to this diarrhea goes away.

I have outlined some useful information on my article: How to protect the gut while traveling. 

  • Boosting the immune system:

According to studies, there is a direct connection between the bacteria in the colon and the nature of the immune system. The more the probiotics you have, the more enhanced your immune system is.

When you are taking antibiotics, it’s common for the medications to wipe out intestinal bacteria thus weakening the immune system. Probiotics work together with the immune system to fight diseases.

  • Better oral health:

In addition to the bacteria being in the digestive system, they are also available in large numbers in the mouth.

According to scientists, the higher the number of the bacteria that you have in your mouth, the better the oral health that you have. When you take probiotics, you have better breath and throat infections go away. The bacteria have also been found to treat periodontal disease.

Where to find probiotics

Probiotics exist naturally in the digestive system; they come from the foods that you eat. If you stay for a long time without eating the bacteria-rich foods or you suffer from a medical condition you will have a probiotics deficiency. If you are having a deficiency, the best way of having the bacteria back into your body is by taking foods that are rich in the bacteria.

Some of the best foods that you should take are:

  • fermented milk,
  • pickles,
  • and vegetables. Some of the best vegetables to take include: shredded beets and carrots.

You can buy probiotics in the form of supplements where they contain different types of bacteria strains and forms. It’s up to you to choose the best one for your needs. Many companies sell supplements and just like in other products.

However, no two companies are the same. When buying probiotics, make sure to buy from a reputable company.

How to use probiotics

There are many brands of probiotics in the market that you can go for but you need to be cautious when using them. While the bacteria might be safe for most people; however if you have an immunodeficiency disease or disorder you are discouraged from using them. As mentioned, there are many probiotic brands in the market. Before buying any, first, consult your doctor to recommend the best.

When making the purchase, pay close attention to the manufacturer. To be on the safe side go with products made from a responsible manufacturer as you are sure that the products are of high quality.

Experts also recommend that you avoid products with aggressive claims. For example, you should stay away from products claiming to treat, prevent or cure certain medical conditions.

How to shop for probiotics?

The top five most important thing to verify:

Quality

It stands for clean, safe and researched. It is a way that the company assures that the product is in good standing (Standard). In some countries, a small label will stipulate the “Manufacturing Process” or Quality Assured.

Potency

Most probiotics have different potency. The potency is measured in CFU (colony forming units). The potency stands for how much you need for a specific condition.

Different strain

It refers to a biological variety within a species. The most researched strain in the world is Lactobacillus.

Stability

This means that to keep the strain certain products have to be refrigerated. Non-refrigerated ones are called shelf-stable and they are very popular for traveling.

Will they survive the journey before being destroyed by stomach acid and/ or bad bacteria?

To avoid such situations, some experts recommend buying enteric-coated probiotics capsules that ensure the bacteria will get safely to the small intestines without interruption.

 

Best Probiotic Foods

 

Probiotic foods are foods that go through an acid fermentation process before these are available for human consumption. The process is done totally or in part. Yogurt is the best probiotic food but there are other good sources of probiotics.

Kefir.

Like yogurt, kefir is rich in probiotics; because it undergoes the same fermentation process and combines milk and animal-derived grain. Most companies use goat milk in kefir preparation. 

In addition to the good lactic acid bacilli, kefir also contains antioxidants that are good for the heart. Kefir is best when it is made by an organic process. 

Sauerkraut.

Sauerkraut is based on cabbage and other vegetables with a similar texture. After cultivation, food preparation is enriched not only with probiotics but also with vitamins A, B, E and C. So, people who eat them regularly say that sauerkraut also helps fight some of the symptoms of certain allergies.

Chocolate.

This is also a probiotic food if it is the rich and dark-colored one. Some studies show that dark chocolates have more probiotic ingredients than dairy products. However, it is only advantageous in terms of tolerance to lactose, if you do not eat too much.

The microalgae.

Edible seaweed is the best form of microalgae that contains probiotics. Other sources include plants that come from the sea, such as:

  • chlorella,
  • spirulina,
  • and phytoplankton.

For more information about Phytoplankton click here. Apart from lactobacilli, microalgae foods are also good sources of energy.

Miso.

This is a favorite Japanese food that people also prefer for its medicinal properties. It is made from grains and beans; it is the main flavor in Japanese soup. As a probiotic food, Miso acts to regulate your digestive system. Miso is packed with nutrition it also helps neutralize carcinogens before they can spread.

Tempeh.

This is exclusively made from soybeans and similarly Asian in origin. It is often used as a meat substitute, the same purpose as tofu. Vegetarians like to bake or sautée the tempeh and eat it as their alternative source of protein that meat provides.

Kimchi.

This is Korea’s answer to the sauerkraut of Germany. Also made from cabbage, kimchi is however fermented to give it a sour and very spicy quality. If you like your food hot, kimchi is among the best probiotic foods because it is also a source of other essential nutrients such as iron, calcium and vitamins A, B1, and B2.

Kombucha.

This one is unique because its preparation involves neither dairy nor grain but tea leaves. Thus, you drink rather than eating it. This tea becomes a probiotic agent when it is fermented. Those who drink kombucha swear that it not only prevents digestive problems but also helps them lose weight.

Final thought:

Most experts recommend taking from 1 to 10 billion as general use for adults depending on their needs. If the person is an adult with a specific condition doctor might recommend up to 150 billion until the balance has been restored. Once the balance is restored eating healthily, consuming fermented products and take lower potency probiotics supplements is the best.
